document.text:
November 30, 2021 
prep 
notes 
AUSAs 
S/ 
• U recalls an address book at the PB residence that he observed during his employment 
for JE: 
o This book was different frofre Roladex. The book was either dark blue or 
black. It was a bit bigger than a big iPhone, very thick, and contained a lot of 
names.. estimates it was between 200 and 300 pages. The book's cover was 
blank, and the pages were black inLarinted on white paper. 
o III first saw the book years beforMleft, in the 1990s around 1994, 1995, or 
1996. IN thinks eithe (both assistants) toldethat he had to 
put the blue/black book on the desk. was told to put book on JE's desk in 
living room, JE's desk in the master bedroom, JE's night table in the master 
bedroom, JE's desk in the cabana, GM's desk next to the pantry room, and by the 
phone in the kitchen. These books were replaced every year and updated with 
more friends and contacts. recollection is that those updates were adding 
entries, not removing entries. 
o 
i 
recalls that Mr. Epstein used the books the most. *has also seen GM use the 
books. doesn't know who added to the books or updated them. 
o 
• 
looked inside the books at the time of his employment, and they contained all 
of Mr. Epstein and Ms. Maxwell's friends and employees, Mr. Epstein's family 
members were there, name was there, Prince Andrew's name was there, 
Donald Trump's name was there. Each page had a name, address, company, 
phone numbers for different homes. In looked through multiple versions of this 
book from mid-1990s until 2002 when left. It included contact information for 
massage therapists, chefs, pilots, houses from ranch and employees who worked 
at different locations at ranch were. 
o When copies of the book were replaced with updated versions, the staff threw out 
the old versions. All versions every year looked the same. No writing on the 
cover. 
• 
•showed the following Government Exhibits: 
. o 
GX-298 
—. 
re
cognizes to be a diagram of first floor of JE PB house. During 
em 
to 
ent, GM's desk was in Garden Room, JE's desk was in Lake 
Room esk was in staff room 
o GX-297 — 
recognizes to be a diagram of second floor of JE PB house. Pink or 
green sofa was in JE's bathroom attached to master bedroom, which is where JE 
got his massages. GM bathroom attached to master bedroom was where basket 
was with sex toys kept in it. 
o GX-299 — 
shows pool house at JE PB property 
o GX-606 recognizes to be document iv to. and his wife around the late 
1990s by GM. It is a copy of pages that. recalls receiving in the form of a 
1 
EFTA00016590

booklet. The document contained all of the tasks that were demanded of him. 
remembers seeing this manual for the first time when a duchess from England 
came. She was a woman who was supposed to be royalty and supposed to teach 
the staff how to properly maintain a house. This document was a booklet 
provided to. by this lady who was hired by JE and GM. 
o There was a different page that was a laminated page with information for the 
guest with contact information, which was not in the booklet and is not in 
this exhibit. 
o When first received this booklet,. told GM, I've been working for this for 
years, I'm not going to do this. GM told many times that this is the way it 
goes and must be. 
o fought with JE once when JE didn't have a pen by his night table with a light, 
and guest didn't have a toothbrush, which was required by the booklet. yelled 
at JE about it. 
o fought more with GM about the handbook. GM complained about food trays 
and other details that did not follow from the handbook. 
o reviewed each page of this exhibit. specifically remembers pages 1- 6 and 
8 being in the version of the booklet he received. Re page 7, remembers he 
was supposed to answer Mr. Epstein residence, never Ms. Maxwell residence, so 
doesn't recall that portion of page 7, but otherwise recognizes it. doesn't 
remember page 9. • remembers page 10 as a checklist that had to follow. 
remembers all the checklists in the manual as tasks he had to complete. MI 
never filled out the checklists. GM asked II to fill out the checklists, but 
never did, and GM was pissed. 
o Lady from England, GM, and JE all called n even though that was not 
his name. 
o was supposed to fill out all of these checklists before JE arrived at PB 
residence. Food had to be thrown out each time JE left, even if it had not gone 
bad. 
o was no longer working for JE when this exhibit is dated in 2005, was gone 
by then, but everything in this exhibit except page 9, a portion of page 7, and a 
portion of page 31 re alcoholic beverages is what remembers from the booklet. 
o read the entire booklet when first given to him in the late 1990s 
o GM told that he was supposed to do all of this work while being "invisible" 
o only remembers receiving one copy of this booklet, which he read but never 
used. This copy is dated later, but it contains the same rules and checklists he had 
to follow. 
o had a uniform he had to wear: black pants, white shirt usually, for parties a 
tuxedo, GM told him what to wear 
o was not supposed to talk to anyone about anything of JE, GM, and the guests; 
applied to all guests; applied to everyone 
o did not discuss personal problems with guests, per the rule 
2 
EFTA00016591

o remembers the rule that a copy of Mr. Epstein and Ms. Maxwell's telephone 
directories must be placed to the right of each telephone (same one talking about) 
o Page 8, followed the rule not to disclose JE and GM behavior 
o References to JE directory versus GM directory: recalls them being the same 
size and same length with same entrances and blank covers, but believes first page 
had JE or 
GM. 
o Ms. Maxwell's Bathroom referenced in checklists was on the right-hand side of 
JE bedroom as you enter; can't recall what photographs were required to be 
placed there. 
o was supposed to complete checklists every time JE arrived 
o Ms. Maxwell's desk was in the garden room 
o Page 24 references special papers made for JE and GM specifically printed 
stationary and supposed to leave it by the desk 
o Page 28 references "Max," was GM's tiny Yorkie terrier.. recalled that GM 
traveled with the dog on JE's plane. 
o Page 31, remembered having to throw out everything even if wouldn't go bad 
(but doesn't remember the Beverages list) 
o Page 36 recalls that he would weekly wipe and sanitize massage tables 
o had to clean bathroom and replace sheets every day 
o Page 55, recalls that JE and GM had the preferences for breakfast listed here 
• JE told how to use the message books and to use them to take messages from the 
beginning of employment. wrote down messages during each phone call. When 
a message book was full, he put it in the storage area next to his desk in the staff room. 
3 
EFTA00016592
